newsitem.title: HONG KONG: TABLE TENNIS-CHINA'S DENG SHOWS HER CLASS IN WORLD CUP.
newsitem.headline: TABLE TENNIS-CHINA'S DENG SHOWS HER CLASS IN WORLD CUP.

text.p: Double Olympic champion Deng
Yaping of China underlined her class and superiority with two
easy group victories on the opening day of the inaugural women's
World Cup on Saturday.
The world number one is strong favourite for the $22,000
first prize in an event which failed to attract Olympic silver
medallist Chen Jing of Taiwan and world number two Qiao Hong of
China.
She started with a straightforward 21-7 21-12 win over
African champion Bose Kaffo of Nigeria and then gained revenge
over Hong Kong's Chan Tan-lui, who beat her in the team final at
the 1994 Asian Games, with a 21-4 21-9 victory to virtually
clinch a quarter-final spot with one group A match to play.
The major surprise of the day came with defeat for Deng's
compatriot Yang Ying, the world number six and England Open
champion, who was beaten 15-21 21-18 22-20 by 47th ranked Marie
Svensson of Sweden in group C.
The group is wide open with Romania's Otilia Badescu beating
European champion Nicole Struse of Germany 21-18 21-9. Struse is
playing in her first event since injuring a calf muscle last
month and looked far from match fit.
"Beating Yang was a good win for me and with Struse losing,
the group is very tight," said Svensson.
All remaining group matches and the quarter-finals are
scheduled for Sunday.
